Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Off-Pump versus On-Pump Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either off-pump or on-pump CABG.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either off-pump or on-pump CABG.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was all-cause mortality, measured over a follow-up period of 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible for patients and clinicians, but outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 5,180 participants were randomised to off-pump CABG and 5,144 to on-pump CABG.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Data were analysed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Analysis showed increased all-cause mortality in the off-pump group (3.7%) compared to the on-pump group (3.1%), with a risk ratio of 1.24 (95% CI 1.01 to 1.53; p = 0.04).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not significantly different between groups.
